language: plus any two languages they knew while alive
language_markdown: [Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20); plus any two languages they knew while alive
markdown:
Some enlightened members of the [Iroran](/Deities.aspx?ID=10) faith, particularly monks, are so aware of their own bodily processes they can sense their approaching death from old age. Pinpointing the occurrence to the exact hour, a chosen few employ a method of self-mummification. These masters of life and death leave behind their bodies to watch over Irori's temples. **[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 32 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 30 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 27 [Iroran Mummy](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1886) **Source** [Book of the Dead](/Sources.aspx?ID=118) pg. 132 **Perception** +21; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12) **Languages** [Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20); plus any two languages they knew while alive **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +25, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +21, [Irori Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +25, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) +21 **Str** +5 **Dex** +7 **Con** +4 **Int** +0 **Wis** +5 **Cha** +3 **Items** _+1 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [returning](/Equipment.aspx?ID=301) [shuriken](/Weapons.aspx?ID=79)_ --- **AC** 31 **Fort** +18 **Ref** +21 **Will** +21 **HP** 190 ([negative healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=42)) **Immunities** [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38) **Weaknesses** [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72) 10 **Aura of Peace** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [enchantment](/Traits.aspx?ID=61), [incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) 30 feet. When a creature enters or starts its turn in the aura, it's affected by [_calm emotions_](/Spells.aspx?ID=31) for 1 minute, with a DC 27 Will save. A creature that succeeds at the save is temporarily immune for 24 hours. If the Iroran mummy takes a [hostile action](/Rules.aspx?ID=300), the aura of peace is suppressed and its effects end for anyone already affected. The Iroran mummy must spend 10 minutes in meditation to restore the aura.
**Robe Tangle** ([divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [move](/Traits.aspx?ID=114), [transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157)) **Trigger** An adjacent creature misses the Iroran mummy with a melee Strike; **Effect** The mummy swaps positions with the attacker, and the attacker becomes [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=20) by the mummy's animated sash. The [Escape](/Actions.aspx?ID=79) DC is 29, the [Force Open](/Actions.aspx?ID=34) DC is 27, and a creature can sever the sash by hitting AC 27 and dealing at least 20 slashing damage. The mummy can't use this reaction again until they've Interacted to reclaim the sash. --- **Speed** 30 feet **Melee** fist +23 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [Unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199)), **Damage** 2d10+11 bludgeoning **Ranged** _shuriken_ +23 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [thrown 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=195)), **Damage** 2d4+11 piercing **Monk Ki Spells** DC 29, 3 Focus Points - **5th** [Ki Blast](/Spells.aspx?ID=484), [Ki Rush](/Spells.aspx?ID=485), [Ki Strike](/Spells.aspx?ID=486), [Wind Jump](/Spells.aspx?ID=490) **Stunning Flurry** **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** The Iroran mummy makes two unarmed Strikes. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses, and the target must succeed at a DC 29 Fortitude save or be [stunned 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=36) (or stunned 3 on a critical failure); this save has the [incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93) trait.
Iroran Preservation [Irorans](/Deities.aspx?ID=10) closely guard the process of creating their mummies. I have gleaned that it involves rituals of fasting and a diet of certain poisonous nuts and teas used as preservatives. The monk must also be in a trance-like meditation at the moment of death. Physical movement and battle strain a dead body, and long stretches of inactivity might turn skin and bone brittle. Many Iroran mummies treat themselves by rubbing their skin with alchemical oils and wrapping their bodies in magically treated cotton or linen. Choosing a suitable resting spot as well as trying to maintain this resting place is equally important. Upon awakening, Iroran mummies often discover they've become a nesting place for birds or bats or acquired a thin layer of moss.
name: Iroran Mummy
